docs.snippet: Mr. Ford, who never got to run the Ford Motor Company, was the last family member to be a confidant of Henry Ford, the American legend who made the automobile accessible to the masses....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Ford, who never got to run the Ford Motor Company, was the last family member to be a confidant of Henry Ford, the American legend who made the automobile accessible to the masses.
docs.abstract: William Clay Ford, scion of Ford Motor Company family, owner of Detroit Lions, and last surviving grandchild of Henry Ford, dies at age 88; Ford represented automaker's last direct link to days when company belonged entirely to Ford family, and was also company's largest shareholder.

headline.main: William Clay Ford, Auto Family Scion and Detroit Lions Owner, Dies at 88
